channel.title: Steam
channel.description: Just wondering if anyone can help me out here. I've been able to play all my steam games under wine but with this install it's messed up. CSS, TF2, L4D2 all end up like this: [URL=http://img826.imageshack.us/i/20100721100532269.jpg/][IMG]http://img826.imageshack.us/img826/889/20100721100532269.th.jpg[/img][/URL] I've read site after site on how to set it up but none seem to help. Im on ubuntu 10.04 with an ATI 5850

item.title: Steam
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

ollie@ollie-laptop:~$ wine --version
wine-1.2
ollie@ollie-laptop:~$ glxinfo
name of display: :0.0
Segmentation fault

Read full topic

item.title: Steam
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

This is no longer needed, I finally got it up and running. Notice I didn’t post since july KO9? lol

Read full topic

item.title: Steam
item.dc:creator: @Wizzup Wizzup?
item.description:
@Wizzup wrote:

What is wine --version?
Same for glxinfo|grep version?

E: The glxinfo may not be too interesting since I am guessing you fixed the graphics bug?

Read full topic

item.title: Steam
item.dc:creator: @KO9 KO9
item.description:
@KO9 wrote:

[quote=“Holic, post:5, topic:350374”][quote author=Elijah link=topic=446738.msg3278697#msg3278697 date=1279736871]
You might be using a new version of WINE that broke compatibility, you might try installing an older version.
[/quote]
Just tried 1.0, Steam wouldn’t even open. I guess I’ll just restart it all from scratch.
Damn.[/quote]
Yeah, I found this… I used to be able to run steam through WINE without a problem. A few Ubuntu updates/upgrades ago and I’ve not been able to open steam since…

ollie@ollie-laptop:~/.wine/drive_c/Program Files/Steam$ wine ./Steam.exe

I can’t see any reason, from the wine output, why it would be crashing… The strange thing is I can type my details etc into the login box fine, it’s just when (I assume) it’s downloading/refreshing the server list.

Read full topic

item.title: Steam
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Elijah:

You might be using a new version of WINE that broke compatibility, you might try installing an older version.

Just tried 1.0, Steam wouldn’t even open. I guess I’ll just restart it all from scratch.
Damn.

Read full topic

item.title: Steam
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

eczema3:

You installed the missing fonts? That may be the problem, missing fonts on wine w/ steam fucks you over a lot. (or it did with me)

I’ve installed all the fonts using winetricks.

Read full topic
